snippet: LEAD: The State Public Utilities Commission today ordered GTE California to cut its telephone rates by $218 million. It was the second rollback ordered this year, and the two together will reduce the company's annual revenue by 13.5 percent, or $3...
lead_paragraph: LEAD: The State Public Utilities Commission today ordered GTE California to cut its telephone rates by $218 million. It was the second rollback ordered this year, and the two together will reduce the company's annual revenue by 13.5 percent, or $330 million. The company's president, David E. Anderson, said the reduction was excessive.

byline.original: Special to the New York Times
